creator: wadori@yahoo.com
text:
I downloaded and installed Apache 2.2 on my Windows Vista machine, but am unable to start Apache.  When I click on Start I recieve the following error meassge:  

An attempt was made to access a socket in a way forbidden by its access permissions.    : make_sock: unable to listen for connections on address 0.0.0.0:80  
no listening sockets available,  shutting down
unable to open logs

I removed Skype from my computer, which I read could be a potential problem.  I tried changing the port to 8080 in httpd.conf, but I get the same error message (except that it cites 0.0.0.0.8080).
A friend of mine solved the problem.  He added my local address (127.0.0.1) in front of the 80 in the "Listen 80" line of my httpd.conf file.
creator: wadori@yahoo.com

text:
Ask on the appropriate peer mailing list.  The issues tracking system is for
software defects, not for user support of misconfigurations.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
